title: Frequent Logout from Mozilla Account on Windows PC
content:
am experiencing an issue where my Mozilla account logs out automatically every time I shut down my Windows PC. Each morning when I start the PC and open Firefox, I am required to log in to my Mozilla account again.

Here are some details about my setup and troubleshooting attempts: 

   Operating System:  Windows version Windows 10 Pro    Firefox Version: latest version    Steps Tried:        Ensured that "Delete cookies and site data when Firefox is closed" is unchecked.        Verified that "Clear history when Firefox closes" is disabled.        Logged out and re-signed into my Mozilla account.        Checked for browser updates and ensured I’m on the latest version.        Tested without extensions by using Troubleshoot Mode.
creator: joshytt

title: Password
content: Hi, I have had Firefox generate a password for my email account. When I tried to access the account, I assumed that the password generated by Firefox would be applied automatically, but this is not the case. how can I proceed? Thanks Hans
creator: zoulek

title: Problema con Marcadores e Historial
content: Hola, hace poco cambie mi pc y al momento de instalar Firefox en el nuevo equipo, todo fue bien excepto los marcadores e historial. Los Marcadores no me figuran, ya hice una copia manual en mi antigua Pc en archivo html y la nueva no me los reconoce como marcadores, tambien probe en restaurar a varias versiones anteriores a la fecha de la nueva Pc y nada. Me salen carteles como "no se pudo procesar el archivo de resguardo". Probe todas las opciones de internet de restaurar, exportar e importar, y nada. Reinicie equipo, desinstale e instale nuevamente. Ademas la sincronizacion se queda trabajando eternamente sin fin. Las claves y demas funcionan bien. El historial no registra ninguna pagina, tanto el de la antigua Pc como las nuevas paginas que visito no figuran. No se que mas probar... Cualquier ayuda se agradece. Saludos.-
creator: lucasuncal

title: Firefox not creating profiles
content:
So I've been beating my head against the wall on this one... first I couldn't load Firefox and the error message would say 'Firefox is active but not responding.' I looked into that, it suggested deleting the profiles.ini file... I did, and it didn't do anything. I then tried deleting the profile folder entirely. That changed the error at least. Now it says 'no profile.'

So, I tried following directions to create a new profile. Win+R, firefox.exe -p and then tried to create a new profile and... nothing. "An unexpected error has prevented your changes from being saved."

Unsure if its connected, but at the same time, several Steam games have been struggling to sync to the cloud, and Discord stopped working to the point I needed a clean install.

Already tried to do a clean install with Firefox and that didn't work either.
creator: rohdrieag

title: Default apps cannot be changed from Microsoft
content: This is a hail Mary. Microsoft changed the behavior of Windows, supposedly for security, so that clicking the Firefox button to make it the default web browser is no longer allowed. Instead, I get taken to the default apps section of Settings, where the only choices are Edge and Internet Explorer. No Firefox. Same with images and with video. Microsoft is not helping with this and I'm damned if I'm wading through probably a hundred or so file extensions changing each one individually. Somebody else must have run across this problem and maybe solved it?
creator: pjcamp

title: How do I make Firefox generate a new secure password, when the one it's already generated contains an objectionable word?
content:
The password generator of Firefox is usually just adequate. However it sometimes generates a password I don't want to use. Maybe it contains a swear, or something gross.

I would have thought if I erased it from the input box, and then hit the option to suggest a strong password over again, it would give a different securely generated password. No go, same one again. I tried going into the password list and removing the password, then going back and hitting the generator again. Must make a new one, right? No, it stubbornly returns the same exact bad one.

What is going on, and how do I make Firefox actually re-do the password generation, instead of repeating the same one?
creator: PAGulley

title: Unable to connect (2024)
content: This past week or two I suddenly have started having trouble connecting to anything connected with Mozilla as well as a few other websites. I didn't notice until I received a notice about a recent Firefox update but Firefox wouldn't update. I ended up uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox and now in addition to that and loosing all my saved themes, add ons, bookmarks, passwords, etc. I can not even add on anything such as ad blockers for example. I am not sure what changed or maybe I made a minor change and forgotten about it but it's very frustrating. I have gone on here searching and trying suggestions using a chrome because I can't do much on Firefox now but I've gotten nowhere. Please Help!
creator: charyl

title: Desktop icons for PDF files are small if defailt PDF reader is Firefox
content:
Hello, When I set the default app for my PDF files to Firefox in Windows 11 Pro, the PDF files I put on my desktop are mostly empty space except for a tiny Firefox logo. Other file icons on the desktop are full-sized and easy to see. Is there a way to make these Firefox/PDF icons full-sized, other than selecting a different default app for PDF files? Screenshot example attached. Thanks! Dave

Microsoft Surface Pro 8 x64 computer Microsoft Windows 11 Pro OS 10.0.22631 Build 22631 (purchased) Browsers: Firefox (main) 132.0.2 (64-bit) Google Chrome Microsoft Edge (not used often) I try to keep all updates and patches applied. No hacks or jailbreaks.
creator: dave.hejde

title: Проблемы с синхронизацией
content: Совершил переустановку Win10. Установил Firefox, вошёл в аккаунт, но ничего не синхронизировалось, как раньше. Сейчас у меня пропали все закладки, пароли и так далее. На кнопку ручной синхронизации нажимал, Firefox переустанавливал.
creator: Imperetss

title: Firefox on Windows 10 Weird Crashing Error
content:
Hello, I've encountered a weird issue with my Firefox browser. If I touch ANY key on my keyboard (mouse is fine) while it is the focused window, it will crash instantly. No question or hesitation. Started at least a week ago, but not sure since I don't type much on this browser, so earlier crashes (very few) could correlate too. Having to use Chrome to actually make this post.

Yes it is updated. Yes I tried opening a second window (crashes both). Yes I tried opening a second window in incognito (crashes both). Yes I've tried safe made by holding Shift while opening. Still crashes, every time.
creator: unhappyhaunter
